description.narrative: The Program Development Objective is to improve the quality, equitable access, and efficiency of basic and secondary education in Nepal by supporting the Government's School Sector Development Program.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Education, Science and Technology
Nepal Ministry of Education, Science and Technology

condition.narrative: The recipient shall carry out the Program Action Plan (PAP) in accordance with the schedule set out in the said PAP in a mannersatisfactory to the Association.

The recipient shall execute the MOU between the MOE and IVA, or any other instrument issued by the IVA to confirm its consent tothe request made by the MOE to be the IVA, if the IVA is a government agency before effective date.

The recipient shall maintain, throughout the period of implementation of the Program, the Financial and Budget Management SupportCommittee, housed within Ministry of Finance: (i) headed by its Joint Secretary; (ii) assisted by competent staff, all withexperience and qualification; and (iii) provided with such powers, financial resources, functions and competencies, appropriate tofulfill their respective functions under the Program.

The recipient shall maintain, throughout the period of implementation of the Program, the Independent Verification Agency (IVA) inaccordance with the terms of the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU)/any other instrument between the Ministry of Education (MOE) andthe IVA.

The recipient shall maintain, throughout the period of implementation of the Program, the SSDP Implementing Committee, housedwithin the Department of Education, under terms of reference satisfactory to the Association: (i) headed by a director general;(ii) assisted by competent staff, all with experience and qualification; and (iii) provided with such powers, financial resources,functions and competencies, appropriate to fulfill their respective functions under the Program.

The recipient shall maintain, throughout the period of implementation of the Program, the Steering Committee with membership,powers, functions and competencies acceptable to the Association, as shall be required to provide policy guidance for, and exercisegeneral oversight of, the implementation of Program activities, including interministerial and sectoral coordination of Programactivities.

The recipient shall, throughout the Program implementation, prepare and share with the Association the draft AWPB for thesubsequent fiscal year, which includes activities under the PAP and the Program Support Facility.

title.narrative: Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
Percentage of funds disbursed to schools in compliance with eligibility and utilization guidelines
Number of schools implementing performance-based grants for meeting minimum accountability requirements

baseline.value: Accountability and performance issues are hard to be addressed through a supply-based approach.

target.value: Performance based grants for schools implemented in 400 LGs

actual.value: 3010 community schools received performance grants in FY 2017/18 and FY 2018/19. The data collection for 400 LGs (end-target) isongoing.

title.narrative: NER in basic and secondary education in 15 most disadvantaged districts as ranked in the equity index (disaggregated by gender)

actual.value: Basic: Total 92.2; Girls 90.9; Boys: 93.4Secondary: Total 44.1; Girls 43.4; Boys 44.9

title.narrative: Strengthened governance, fiduciary management, data systems, and institutional capacity for results-based program implementation

baseline.value: Enhanced fiduciary system is not in place.85% accuracy in self-reported student and teacher data (from the 2014 PublicExpenditure Tracking Survey)Absence of a system to verify school funds eligibility and utilization compliance Need for enhancedand specific institutional capacity (TA) for results-based program implementation

target.value: a) Percentage of audit observation of SSDP no more than 5% of total SSDP expenditure (b) 97% accuracy in self-reported studentand teacher data (from third round of EMIS verification) (c) School level expenditure reporting through school accounting systemsoftware piloted in 2000 schools

actual.value: a) Percentage of audit observation of SSDP no more than 0.25% of total SSDP expenditure in FY2019/20.(b) and (c) not yet due.

title.narrative: Survival rate to Grade 8 and to Grade 12 (disaggregated by gender)

baseline.value: Grade 8 All: 76.6 percentBoys: 75.9 percentGirls: 77.4 percentGrade 12 All: 11.5 percent

target.value: Grade 8 All: 92 Boys: 91.2 Girls: 93 Grade 12 All: 25 Boys: 12 percentage point increase from Year 1Girls: 12 percentagepoint increase from Year 1

actual.value: Grade 8 All: 82.2Girls: 82.9Grade 12: All: 29.2Girls: 29.7

title.narrative: Assessment and examination system reforms undertaken to improve teaching and learning

baseline.value: Letter grading and single-subject certification introduced in Grade 10 Inadequate capacity to carry out high-qualitycompetency-based assessmentsPublic examinations (Grades 8, 10, and 12) not standardized

target.value: (a) MOEST approves a framework for conducting the SEE exams at the provincial level.(b) ERO has analyzed NASA results for theprevious year in actionable form.

actual.value: Year-three target “Single subject certification policy for Grades 11 and 12 implemented” is met. The end target (a) on theframework for conducting SEE exam at provincial level is currently being discussed; and (b) analysis of NASA results is inprogress.

baseline.value: Limited teacher accountability (low levels of TST)

target.value: TST monitoring system operational in 229 LGs.

actual.value: TST monitoring system operational in 229 LGs.

title.narrative: Number of secondary schools receiving pro-science grants to offer science stream

baseline.value: Low enrolment of students in science streams

actual.value: 422 (model schools)

title.narrative: Share of students enrolled in science subjects in Grades 11 and 12

baseline.value: Low enrolment of students in science streams

actual.value: Year 2077: 17 as reported by NEB for Grade 12. Grade 11 data not available with NEB as the examination was held internally byschools due to CoVID 19 school closures.Year 2076: 15.7 (Grades 11 and 12).

baseline.value: Number of teachers identified nationally for redeployment

target.value: Number of teachers to be redeployed reduced by 60% of the baseline

actual.value: The end-of-project for this indicator was reported as achieved. Number of teachers to be redeployed reduced by 72% of the baseline.

title.narrative: Implementation of pro-poor targeted scholarships (PPTS) and pro-science targeted scholarships (PSS)

baseline.value: Scholarship schemes are not pro-poor targetedShare of science enrolment in Grades 11 and 12 is very low.

target.value: (a) Standards, operational policies and guidelines (SOPG) on the implementation of PPTS and PPS approved(b) PPTS and PPS isrolled out nationally as per the updated SOPG for implementation(c) Share of girls benefitting from PPTS and PPS is 45 percent

actual.value: Standards, operational policies and guidelines (SOPG) on the implementation of PPTS and PPS approved. Verification is ongoing

baseline.value: School profile cards not used for conducting social audits in schools

target.value: School profiles from EMIS generated and used in social audits annually to improve school performance

actual.value: District and school profile cards implemented in all schools by linking with school performance grants.

title.narrative: National Curriculum Framework (NCF) revised and implemented

baseline.value: Secondary curriculum does not adequately serve the needs of diverse student population.

actual.value: The revised curriculum for Grade 9 has been piloted. The verification is currently ongoing.

title.narrative: Number of schools receiving block grants

baseline.value: Serious accountability problems in the current model of community schools are hard to address.

target.value: Number of schools meeting minimum standards for ECED is 8,000

actual.value: An ERO study conducted in 2019 reported that 78% of schools selected in the sample met minimum conditions in 15 districts. Datafrom EMIS is not yet available on this indicator. The Bank plan to conduct a survey to collect the data for this indicator as partof the ICR.

title.narrative: Number of out-of-school children brought to schools or LCs

actual.value: The Year 4 and 5 target was reported as achieved during the JRM but the achievement report has not yet been received.

title.narrative: Percentage of students displaying grade-level competency on core subjects in Grade 8 measured through NASA

target.value: Year 4: Second competency-based test conducted for Grade 8, which reported 3 percentage point increase from baseline.

actual.value: in progress/ not yet available

title.narrative: Number of LGs that have implemented alternative mode of learning during COVID-19 schools closures

actual.value: The achievement report confirms that 520 LGs have implemented different alternative learning modalities based on a survey conductedby Center for Education and Human Resource Development. Of these 520 LGs, 422 LGs were noted to implement modes of learning thatinvolve teachers i.e., teachers teaching in small groups in community schools. Out of 422 such LGs, 145 LGs are excluded as theyhave already been included under TST DLI. Hence, the DLI is a fully achieved for 277 LGs.

title.narrative: Number of basic education level (pre-primary to Grade 8) students who can access inclusive distance learning supported through the project

actual.value: 2,401,104 (students benefitting from multiple platforms)

title.narrative: Number of children from marginalized background/ with no access to media or internet provide with printed learning packs and materials.

actual.value: 201,108 (updated data) provided by LGs through EMIS in 2021/22. The previous data was reported in the survey done by CEHRD in Sep/Oct 2020.

title.narrative: Number of grade - specific lessons supported through the project broacasted

actual.value: 2197 for Grades 1-12 (of which 1250 for grades 1-8).

title.narrative: Number of children provided access to programs and sensitization campaigns to minimize the negative impacts of school closures, with a focus on girls

actual.value: 351,452 (includes teachers facilitation and zoom classes for Grades PPE-8 as per the emergency action plan)

title.narrative: Number of of grant-supported schools equipped with minimum hygiene standards for prevention of CoVID 19
Number of children supported with accelerated learning program to mitigate the learning loss during school closure

actual.value: Data is currently being collected. Budget allocated in FY21-22 to support 746296 children

title.narrative: Number of basic education teachers in community schools trained in (i) addressing learning gaps; and (ii) digital skills

actual.value: Data not yet available. Expected to be available after end of AY
The learning portal is functional.

title.narrative: Evaluation of distance learning program conducted

target.value: Evaluation of distance learning program conducted

actual.value: A survey on distance learning program was conducted by CEHRD in September 2020.
Project Implementation Manual is developed and approved

title.narrative: School reopening framework and distance learning guidelines disseminated to sub-national governments

target.value: School reopening framework and distance learning guidelines disseminated to sub-national governments

actual.value: The school reopening framework was developed, approved and disseminated to LGs.

title.narrative: Number of LGs that have implemented catch-up program

actual.value: Not yet due

title.narrative: Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning - Female
